Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: rnagara
Reviews.Content: We had booked a family room with 2 queen beds for 3 nights. The room size was pretty decent for a family room. Comfortable for 4 adults. Got it for about SGD240 per night including breakfast, which is not bad at all by Singaporean standards. Location wise it is pretty good in the sense that it is close to Bras Basah MRT and YMCA bus stop. In fact, except to the Zoo we took the MRT to most of the places. There is a Kopitam food court right opposite which is open 24hrs. It costs about SGD25 to the zoo and the bird park. About SGD 30 to the airport. SO it was quite convinient. Orchard road is right behind the hotel. The only minus is the MRT construction going on in Bencoolen street. You will have to walk to Bras Basah road to catch a taxi since most taxis dont come into Bencoolen street. The waiters in the restaurant are a little rude sometimes. Otherwise, it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Wanderworld13
Reviews.Content: Singapore hotels are expensive. We were therefore happy to find Stand Hotel at a fairly reasonable rate of 160 Singapore Dollars for a Deluxe Double Room. Booking was done over telephone and we did not have to pay any advance as we were scheduled to reach before 5 in the evening. We had taken two rooms as we have two teen-aged kids, the rooms were next to each other. Its basically a no frills hotel, but very clean, bathrooms are clean too. Room size is comfortable. LCD TV in the room. Air conditioning worked fine. Rooms were cleaned everyday, towels changed. You have to make a refundable deposit of Sin $ 20 for a hairdryer, which is refunded when you return the drier to the reception. Staff was helpful and cordial. A huge breakfast was served on the house - toast, noodles, pancakes, cornflakes, juice, milk, eggs, sausages, hash-browns..... Work for the Bencoolen MRT station is going on close by, but there is no mess and the sound is not disturbing with the windows closed. Wasn't a problem where we were concerned. Its not a fancy hotel, but comfortable and safe for a family. The location could not have been better, with Dhoby Ghaut and City Hall MRT stations, the famous Orchard Street, the museum, Raffles City Centre, all within easy walking distance. The harbour front is not too far away. And for meals, there is the Kopitiam Hawker Centre just across the street facing the hotel. All in all very convenient. Very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Families do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: Bvesh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night with my family as all the other htels where full and we dint know that it wasnt a "suitable" hotel for families.lobby was small and ugly i do not recomend this hotel to anyone who is coming with their family member or cousins not a decent hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Maryam M
Reviews.Content: Strand hotel is a cozy, clean and comfortable hotel. It's located in a central area, close to popular tourist attractions. The staff at the front desk are very helpful and pleasant. The rooms were nice and comfortable. Luckily we received a room at the back and so we weren't disturbed by the MRT project. The breakfast is pretty basic however plentiful. It's the perfect choice if you are looking to spend more time exploring Singapore and simply need a place to sleep. The hotel does not have a swimming pool or a gym. Overall it was a lovely stay with no complaints :)

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Strand”
Reviews.Author: LindaO19
Reviews.Content: My son (adult) and I stayed at the Strand in a twin room for a total of 11 days during April, 12 and enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We had no issues with the MRT building project outside, taxis found us, easy access to Bras Basah MRT ( just round the corner), 7-11 and Kopitiam across the road, coffee shop around the corner. WiFi worked most of the time, breakfast included in the room rate was fine and when we wanted something different there was always the many other places 2 minutes from the door. The rooms were fine for the price in central Singapore - and very easy walk to Chimes, Raffles, Museum, etc etc. To book you have to send a couple of emails but they are good at answering enquiries and I had no issues with either checkin or checkout. There is no pool at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, basic but comfortable, ideal for stopovers”
Reviews.Author: hktelfords
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Strand Hotel, en-route between the UK and Australia. Had booked via email with their helpful staff (thanks Philina). All we really wanted was somewhere to sleep off our jet-lag in between seeing sights, and the Strand was just fine for this. The location is perfect for busy visitors. A few minutes from main shopping (Orchard Road) and tourist sights (Raffles, Little India, riverfront). MRT (tube/subway) station just around the corner. Convenience shop (7-Eleven) and 24hrs food hall (Kopitiam) across the street, other cafes nearby. Other good points: Good value given the location - family room for 5 + breakfasts cost S$280/night (£140/US$225). Polite and helpful staff - refused to be tipped until we insisted on leaving some $ to be shared out. Family room was basic but spacious and clean, with TV and fridge. Breakfast was basic but plentiful - a cooked plate Western style (bacon, eggs, etc) plus self-serve of noodles, cereals, breads, fruits, drinks. Not so good: Construction site right outside the front door, which will continue until 2017 - however, we had a front-facing room and we weren't bothered by the noise of work. Hints on Singapore: Use the MRT whenever possible - it's cheap, frequent, safe, and air-conditioned. Don't miss the Zoo and the Night Safari in the north of the island - the best way there and back is a Singapore Attractions Express (SAEX) coach. Nearest SAEX stop is in Prinsep Street, 1 block from the Strand - there are only a few per day so check timetable in advance. We love Singapore and if/when we return we'd happily use the Strand again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location....”
Reviews.Author: HellenK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last February 19-21,2012. We were 12 in a group and we reserved 3 rooms. The hotel is centrally located. It is near Bugis, Sim Lim Square, Bras Basah station, Dhouby ghaut station and Orchard Road. Wendy's, 711 store, Kopitian(a food court) is located opposite the hotel. There are also many shops and eateries outside the hotel. Riding the bus is a no problem since a bus stop is only walking distance from the hotel. The room where we stayed is big. It has a ref and a bathtub. The bathroom is also very clean. The staff are very efficient, friendly and very accommodating. A buffet american breakfast is also served daily. It tastes good too.... I highly recommend Strand Hotel. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Decent”
Reviews.Author: NCNG
Reviews.Content: We were staying at family room for 4 adults, the room is very long ~ 1 Queen & 2 single beds. The toilet was clean! Complimentary breakfast was semi-buffet + American Breakfast set, taste good too. We chose this hotel because it 's the cheapest hotel we could get with free parking (can park at least more than 10 cars). The location is opposite construction area but you wont hear any noise in the room day & night. It is easy to find as we were driving our own car from KL. It is also easy to get a cab & take MRT. It is 10 minutes walking distance from Bugis Street. I am glad because the quality of the room & services that we got are above average :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: ayson97
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Strand for 3 nights. Check in was a breeze. Our deluxe room 915 was spacious with clean bed, cabinet and bathroom. Only downside was that the carpet needed more thorough cleaning. We ended up really using the slippers they provided. Water pressure and water temp were great. Refrigerator was working well. Great for the mineral water & soda we bought from 7-11 just outside the hotel. Bring your own soap, shampoo and conditioner if you don't prefer 2-in-1 shampoo/body wash in dispensers. Wifi during our stay was fair. Hotel is just 2 minutes walk from Bras basah MRT. In walking distance to Orchard, Funan & Cold Storage supermarket, SimLim, Bugis and several Catholic Churches. SAEx bus going to Singapore Zoo passes 3x a day by the bus stop on Prinsep St. near Hotel Rendezvous which is adjacent to Strand. For us, the breakfast was more than sufficient to start our day. The cafe is rather small and can easily get crowded. The construction in Bencoolen St. is in full swing. Good thing was we were out of the hotel before 9am most of the time so we were not bothered much with this. However when we checked out around 10am on our third day, we noticed that the vibrations can become bothersome after some time. For its value and location, will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Old but convenient”
Reviews.Author: natster2002
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in this hotel over 8 years ago, and when I had to look for a last-minute option last year to travel to Singapore, I could not find something within my budget and requirements. So I decided to try staying at The Strand Hotel, Singapore again. Not expecting very much, as there was hardly any photos online to provide an indication of the current condition of the hotel. The hotel is old, rather tired-looking in some ways. But the front-desk staff are pleasant and accommodating. The rooms were slightly musty and needed and airing. But both the rooms and bathrooms were clean. Breakfast is very basic buffet and your "main item" is ordered and cooked on the spot. As the breakfast area is small, its good to plan in advance so that you do not rush with other people. Location is fantastic, its near a 24-hour convenience store, near the smaller train lines just around the corner, and its only two turns away from Orchard road - the shopping hub of Singapore. It was a pleasant walk going down Orchard and you get to see more, rather than sitting in the underground trains. It's also very easy to get taxis from here to Clarke/Boat Quay and we even got a taxi to Marina Bay Sands Theater. Will definitely stay for the convenience and proximity to all the key locations. The building could do with a refurbishment though.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location and value”
Reviews.Author: Jefrisarean
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Strand Hotel 3 times already, I have enjoyed my stay every time. The location is convenient away for the busy from Orchard Road but still close to walk to. Lots of eateries nearby especially my favourite food court KOPITIAM. Walking distance to Funan Centre and Plaza Sinagpura. The price includes breakfast and the meals offered are excellant. Every time I plan to go to Singapore, i will always make sure that i will be staying at Strand Hotel. If you budget traveller, you should try this hotel, it will not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Best family accomodation”
Reviews.Author: sfy8
Reviews.Content: It's hard to find a hotel that can fit even 3-4 adults but this hotel's family room can accomodate up to 6 adults! The size of the room is huge enough - not too cram. Location is realy good - very near to archard road. Best value of money!~

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: almacedillo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located near some shopping malls, the famous bugis st., convenience stores (just across the street), serangoon (little india, mustafa center - you can walk like what my husband and I did or take a taxi or the bus) and eateries. Even though most of Bencoolen street where the hotel is located is closed due to MRT construction, our taxi was still able to bring us right in front of the hotel. Check in was fast and easy; we were asked to pay in full right away which was just fine with us because that would mean fast check out. Extra charges apply when you make local calls but very minimal (about 20 cents). Amenities were basic: toothbrush and toothpaste, all-in-one handwash/bodywash/shampoo/ conditioner, toilet paper and paper slippers. The bath tub and attached shower are a big help for tired feet after going around. The room also had a small fridge, safe, TV and thermos/hot pot. There is also free internet access although sometimes the signal gets lost but over-all it was ok. Another option would be using the computers at the lobby which would require you to drop 1 dollar for a 15-minute usage but computer is old and a bit slow. Even if there was very noisy construction outside, it was not a problem at all once you are inside the hotel. Going around tourist spots from the hotel was not a problem because the hotel is very near 2 bus stops and MRT. There is ample guide and information for bus routes and fares in the bus stops. Breakfast is hefty - sausage, bacon, hash brown, baked beans and eggs served on a platter plus you can still choose from noodles, pancake, french toast, bread, cereal, coffee, juice or tea from the buffet. For us, this is more than enough to start your day. Staff were helpful - gave clear directions when we asked for advice plus all the brochures necessary for all activities you may want to explore are available in the lobby near the elevators. They can also call a taxi for you if you need one. On our last day, it was raining hard but we didn't have to worry about waiting for a taxi. Ask for a higher floor with view. We stayed at Room 804 which had a good view of the swimming pool and small garden of the nearby Rendezvous Hotel. By the way, since Rendezvous Hotel is practically a stone's throw away, we were able to try their buffet (good and reasonable) plus at least 3 more restaurants in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: inutme
Reviews.Content: Location: - Awesome location - 2-3 minutes away from bus station -- depends how fast or slow you walk - 3-5 minutes away from MRT station (Bras Basah) -- depends how fast or slow you walk - On the opposite side of Kopitiam - On the opposite side of 7-11 (Kopitiam and 7-11 are next to each other) - Only a small 2-way lane separates the hotel and the Kopitiam/7-11 Rooms: - Big rooms for big groups - Our room was able to fit 4 singles and 2 extra beds - Minimal toiletries available, free toothpaste is a joke, so make sure to bring your own toothpaste if you're picky about this - I would like to say though that this is a very tiny discomfort and wouldn't really bring down my rating for this hotel - Free disposable room slippers are available - There's an all-in-one body wash/shampoo/conditioner dispenser in the shower area (there literally is just one product and it claims to be multipurpose) - Both room and toilet were clean - It's one of those hotel rooms with dim yellow lights, although if you turn on all the lights, the room would be fairly bright - I just mentioned the info above as I'm not a fan of yellow and/or dim room lights although some people may not really care Staff: - Helpful enough - Didn't have problems with them at all Free Breakfast: - Bacon, Egg, Hot Dogs are the ones served on your table - There's a buffet table that has unlimited bread which you can pop into the toaster if you want - There's also kuey teow (not sure of spelling) in the buffet table - Other items in the buffet table: water, juice, coffee, tea, fruit jam, butter Note: At the time of visit (January 2012), there was an ongoing construction on the road (maybe?) in the vicinity of the hotel, however, I'd like to note that this didn't really pose any huge inconveniences

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: divIndonesia
Reviews.Content: Location wise, this hotel is perfect!! MRT Bras Basah, Kopitiam and 7Eleven store just across the street. For Moslem, a mosque is located about 50m to the left. Next to the mosque, there is also a Halal food stall (HJ. Maemunah Restaurant). A health clinic with general medical doctor is just beside the hotel. Rooms are spacious with old smell, beds and toilets are clean. Construction is still going, not a nice thing to see, but Taxi still can drive though their driveway, so there will be no problem at all if you have luggage with you. Noise from the construction, is not a problem for us at all, as the building is noise-proof enough. For the price, I would not say that this is considered a “budget” hotel, as the rate is almost the same with, say, Ibis Hotel Novena. Rate at Mid February 2012: Single/double S$160Nett Triple S$200Nett Family of 4 S$240Nett Every additional guest joining the room needs to pay additional S$40Nett per room per nite Other than construction site, some negative I felt is that instead of paying the bill at the check-out time, we have to pay the bill daily. Otherwise someone from the receptionist will call and ask you to pay..

Reviews.Title: “Best option for backpacker!”
Reviews.Author: nickladelaide
Reviews.Content: Made a backpack trip to South East Asia in late 2011 and Singapore was the first place in my “tracking-list”,took this hotel through tripadvisor and completely please with it,thanks a lot tripadvisor,u totally complete my “expedition” lol. Got a 7th floor standard room,very spacious,clean and bright at day. The hottub water working just fine,better than anyplace I could find before,like,I got what I want,warm water-then I got warm water,don’t have to jump in and out when the water gets too hot or cold. The only annoying thing about this room is the pillow,found out its just too soft for my heavy-head,and when called receiption,the only answer always received was “sorry,we’re running out of extra stock”..so,during my 5 days trip,have to fold up the pillow and put up some of my clothes in order to get a good sleep. Almost forget the location! “Convenient”! That’s the only word could describe the location of this place, walking-distance to Orchard St,one of my alltime favorite St and close to the train station,too!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: olivia o
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here for many many times and Strand hotel is decent and good value for money. Situated in very good location as train station and big shopping mall are nearby.There is a convenient store Seven eleven and food court in front of the hotel open 24 hours. So convenient as you just have to cross the street to get a variety of foods any time of the day or even in middle of the night. Room and toilet are clean but a bit old and run down. Seemed to be always run out of stock/unavailable every time we requested for extra pillow/ blanket or hair dryer. For Singapore, this hotel will make a good choice if you are on a budget but expect for a good location. After all, this is a budget hotel and you get what you paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Pros & Cons - Bencoolen St. is a construction site”
Reviews.Author: woolymitts
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about this hotel. We stayed in this hotel back in 2005 on a family trip & had good memories of it, so decided to stay here again. We got a Standard double bedroom for 6 nights, and paid SGD 140 per night. Complementary breakfast was included. Singapore is a very expensive city so this was a good deal. Booking was a hassle. This hotel is not listed in any of your regular online booking sites (including tripadvisor). Their website doesn't provide enough information on rates/room availability either, so we had to email back & forth to sort out our booking. Wasn't excruciating, but still was a hassle. On the plus side, this hotel was available, during peak holiday time. We got a surprise when we got off the taxi. We were dropped off on top of Bencoolen St: The part of Bencoolen Street where the Strand is located is closed off to traffic and is essentially a construction site. Apparently it is going to remain this way until 2016 (they're building an MRT line). I would've appreciated it if the hotel had bothered to mention this information to us beforehand. The staff were friendly enough given the Singaporean standards of "friendliness". The doorman insisted on a tip for pulling our bag down the stairs and putting it in the taxi. The room was sparse & comfortable, working airconditioning, the beds were fresh and clean, but can't say the same for the rest of the room. The windows hadn't had a clean for ages and the carpets were a bit icky and were not vacuumed properly. The bathtub fittings were aged and were a bit worse for wear. But the bathroom was clean. The rooms were cleaned daily. The complementary breakfast consisted of a buffet (tea, coffee, juice, pancakes or french toast, fruit slices, noodles, toast, bread) and a set meal of eggs, baked beans, sausages and bacon strips (no bacon for halal). It's no fine dining restaurant but this was quite alright and filling. You get your "breakfast vouchers" daily, from the reception. Excellent location despite being in the middle of a construction site. The Bras Basah MRT station is a few meters away, and not too far from Bugis or Dhoby Ghaut either. The decor was a bit questionable. It felt as if someone started prettying the place up and went "that'll do" half-way through. There was some sort of jungle/human anatomy theme going on which was a bit off-putting. But hey... it's a budget hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fishwifeSydney
Reviews.Content: If you're on a budget, this is a great option. It is in a fantastic location. Easy walk to Orchard Road, two minutes from the MTR station which will take you wherever you want to go. The rooms are huge! We stayed in a family room - my husband and I and two of our children. There were beds for all of us and still room for my daughter to turn cartwheels. Breakfast is interesting. You sit down and automatically get a plate of eggs, sausages, bacon, baked beans and something else either a hash brown or a pancake etc. You then help yourself to toast, fruit, juice, coffee and tea and cereal. It's clean, big, in a great location, with excellent water pressure in the shower and free WiFi! What more do you need!

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: pass_d_duchy
Reviews.Content: My friends and I got a family room... 1 double bed, 2 single beds. It was perfect for us! Cable was ok and so is the hot and cold shower. You could see the the main street from our window. Across the st. there's a 711 store and lots of restaurants. We are very near the subway and bus stops and a few blocks away from Cathay mall, I.T / electronics mall and Bugis Junction. Really a nice location :)

Reviews.Title: “Better place in singapore”
Reviews.Author: pancho123
Reviews.Content: I was at hotel strand for 3days with my husband and 2yrs old baby.we gotta nice clean large room with good view.clean and big barthroom.they are giving free breakfast buffet with many stuff. Hotel is very close to orchard road. Nice hotel.good service from the staff specially from philina at front desk.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time around is a charm”
Reviews.Author: jasmine3689
Reviews.Content: i have stayed in this hotel twice.last 2009 and yesterday i stayed this hotel again. I chose a standard room,my room is in the 9th floor. cost: standard room :Sgd 140 with breakfast already. (dont expect a very GRAND BREAKFAST) I like about the room is that it is very spacious, carpeted floor, big window, cabinet is so cute,only has 5 or 4 hangers though. CLEAN!! Comfort room: hot water is working. have your own bathtub. provides slippers. Be accustomed to local peoples who are working in this industry, they are not the type who always smile. but they are ok. Location: bencoleen street is very near the city,you can walk to orchard and bugis too. Catholic church is also nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline M
Reviews.Content: Booked online and stayed in Strand Hotel, Bencoolen St. last Oct. 20-23 for 3 nights in triple room. Very near to all tourist spots, just one hotel away to the bus stop, across the hotel is MRT. Staff are accommodating, courteous and respond to requests at once. The lowest rate I found for a spacious room, comfortable bed and cool aircon. Breakfast is okay, aside from the set breakfast served we can get from the buffet of unlimited drinks, pansit variety, pancakes and toasts. My child who is free of charge was able to eat with us on breakfasts, I shared with him my set breakfast and he is allowed to get from the buffet. Our room is cleaned and sanitized everyday. Very much happy with this hotel and the rates.

Reviews.Title: “it is home to us in singapore”
Reviews.Author: dennis l
Reviews.Content: the hotel is reasonably priced and well maintained and in a very convenient location. can easily walk to orchard road, plaza singapura, to Bras Basah MRT and Doby Ghaught Station.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget stay for families”
Reviews.Author: mummytraveller64
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Strand in August for 6 nights as a family of 5 travelling on a budget. Booking was made via email direct with the hotel, which was efficiently attended to by Philina. We paid S$280nett for our Family room which includes b/fast for 5. Cons: - Hotel was dated and tired and in need of a refurb. Public areas and lifts had an old musky smell. - Room decor also in need of an upgrade (lime green walls are quite a sight!). - Very worn carpet. - Poor lighting in room. Pros: - Good service during booking and check-in. - Good service from pleasant doormen and friendly housekeeping staff (they looked like retired uncles & aunties). - Huge room, with 2 Queen beds and 1 Single bed, and abundance of bedside counters, shelving, bench space (perfect for laying out the many items that come with a family). - Ample wardrobe space and space to lay out suitcases. - Clean and comfortable beds and pillows. - Separate WC (very clean) with a counter lavatory, useful for washing and drying children's drink bottles etc. - Separate Shower (very clean) with a shower head that can be adjusted to suit children's heights (very mummy-friendly for giving little kids a good shower), another pedestal lavatory which is wonderful for the morning rush. - Fresh towels supplied daily, hairdryer supplied on request. - Bar refrigerator, kettle and in-room safe, all very useful. - Free wifi, very very useful for daddy's work and for children's online games (bring an extension chord and adaptors, there is only 1 power s.o. in the room). - Great hearty breakfast set every morning (2 eggs, 2 sausages, 2 bacon, hashbrown and baked beans) and you can help yourself to the buffet spread of fresh bread/toast with quality butter/jam, cornflakes, fresh fruits, fried noodles, milk, coffee/tea, juice (we can't understand how other reviewers can say that the breakfast is terrible?). We had to bring little containers to take-away the leftovers of the b/fast sets that our little kids can't finish (great for snacks at a later time). - Hotel location is handy for transports, museums, food and shopping. When so many pros outweigh the cons, and when there is a budget to work with, consider the Strand. We had a very pleasant stay there. Mummy especially enjoyed the abundance of spaces for keeping the room neat and orderly!

Reviews.Title: “For Singapore - this is good value!”
Reviews.Author: AbbyMermie
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough not to foot the bill for this stay, as Singapore is really expensive when it comes to hotels. Stayed in a double room (spacious) and paid an extra 40-something dollars to have a third bed put in. The hotel is definitely lacking in quality decor. Our room was old, but the decor looked newer, but still wasn't nice-looking because of the cheap materials used. But the place was clean! One of our party left the bathroom in a terrible state each day, but poor hotel staff did an excellent job cleaning it up, EVERYDAY! The breakfast is free, but very ordinary: hot dogs (they call them sausages!), hash brown and eggs cooked fresh, but there's also toast, noodles, fruit juice, coffee and tea, on the buffet table. As for location, I personally fell in love with Bencoolen St area! There's the Kopitiam food court across the street - my regular tea/coffee spot; Further walking will lead you to Fort Canning Park - a beautiful spot for a morning run, or and afternoon stroll; a walk North up Serangoon road will lead you straight to Little India; staying on Bencoolen and heading north-east, will lead you to the start of Bugis market; a walk south along Bras Basah Rd will lead you to raffles. So as you can see, you can get to many places in Singapore from this hotel, without hailing a single taxi! (Not to mention the cash you'll save.) But if you do need a taxi, there's a stand on the road, but so are some bus stops, and there's also the Bras Basah MRT station on the corner (although you could walk to Dhoby Ghaut MRT, too) Overall, Strand Hotel is ideal for families on a budget, and its lack of luxury is more than made up for by the highly convenient surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “In a city of overpriced hotels this represents good value”
Reviews.Author: Dennis146
Reviews.Content: The Strand Hotel is an old hotel but they have refurbished the rooms and installed wood floors in the corridors. It is the noisy type of wood floor but still it is clean and brightens the place. The rooms are quite big and light with PVC windows. Even facing on to Bencoolen Street it is not noisy in the room. They have very good basement parking. Don't expect dynamic staff but it isn't a problem. The breakfast is pre-prepared and it is pot luck if it is cold or hot. Best not to bother as Kopi Tiam is opposite with a good selection of Chinese, Indian, Thai, Mexican food.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location with suck service!”
Reviews.Author: egizkahlua g
Reviews.Content: i went there with my family and stayed in spacious room.we likes the room,clean and big space.the location is good also,close to shopping area and there is a 24h food court opposite the hotel...but unfortunatelly the service from receiption is the worst service i ever had! not friendly at all!!! i wanna go back to strand hotel for their value but not to see all of them!!!

Reviews.Title: “convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: mndb73
Reviews.Content: If you will be travelling with your families/friends to Singapore and would want to stay in one room this is the hotel you should consider. We got a big room in the 1oth floor that can accommodate up to 7 pax. The room is simple with basic toilet and bath amenities. The free breakfast is served in the small cafe beside the lobby, they give you a selection of noodles/pancakes/sausages or rice with coffee or tea... dont expect anything grand in this hotel. The negative side of this hotel was that my son got bedbug bites in his back and we did not bother to use the kettle (for heating water for coffee/tea) cause it is "full " of rust inside! but aside from that two issues, this hotel is very well situated in the middle of action in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: schizophrenic
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd time here and I'll definitely come back again for the value. The room may not be as good as St Regis or Concorde Singapore but for the price and location, it is definitely worth it. The nearest SMRT station is about 10mins walk and Orchard rd is just around the corner. However, the online booking system at the hotel could be improved.

Reviews.Title: “Can not beat price for the location”
Reviews.Author: tinyhunter
Reviews.Content: I was for a 8 day meeting in Singapore and was looking for a cheap, clean hotel in the center. This hotel does look a bit worn out at certain levels, but the bath room and room was clean and tidy. Breakfast is always the same, but included and could be worse, especially how much does one really eat for breakfast. The location was great and the price more than good. I stayed here for 9 days and had no issue with it, as I have stayed in more expensive hotels that where worse. About 15 cab ride from the airport, ~15 min walk to the marina and the river where you can find lots of restaurants. Wifi is free but not that good in every room. with 6.5" the bed was a bit short, still comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: mariamarauder
Reviews.Content: http://mariamarauder.blogspot.com/2011/04/singapore-vacay-day-2-night-in-safari.html We found the Strand Hotel in Bencoolen St., a stone’s throw away from a train station where we would be alighting from the airport. Across it was a fast food restaurant, Kopitiam, and 7-11. It could accommodate all the five of us in one room, with 2 queen sized beds and one single bed. The toilet and bath are separated, so it’s ideal for a group of people. They had free breakfast for the five of us—poached eggs, 2 chicken hotdogs, 2 pieces hash browns, and some beans. Plus, we could also get from their buffet table—toasted bread, noodles, and beverages. At a price of S$280 a night (Php9,500+), I think there was nothing we could ask for. (Okay, maybe more smiles from the staff would make it perfect?) (Fresh from the oven: The Hubby complained to the hotel today (April 28) because when he checked his credit card bill online, he was surprised that they charged us twice for our stay! When he emailed the Strand, they admitted they made a mistake and said they would cancel the billing at once.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby but Okay”
Reviews.Author: remittancegirl
Reviews.Content: Singapore's hotels are almost all ridiculously overpriced for what you get. Keeping that in mind, The Strand is in a good location - very close to public transport, art gallery and malls. The rooms are adequately sized and have everything you'd expect - tv, fridge, safe - for a low budget hotel. The whole room was a little run down - damp on the walls, scratched up furniture, a carpet that doesn't exactly lie flat - but it was clean and there was plenty of hot water. The bathroom had a bit of black mold here and there, and that rubber slip mat they give you for the bath is there for a reason - the tubs have been finished in something very slippery, so use the mat or watch out! As others have said, the free breakfast is awful. Give it a miss. There's a Kopitiam across the street that does a good breakfast at a very reasonable price. However, the coffee bar outside the hotel will make you a very good cappuccino. The wifi is free but it does go up and down a lot. However, it did work while I was there.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: rickyb62
Reviews.Content: I used this Hotel as a transit hotel heading back to Thailand. Very good value for money in Singapore which you pay through the nose for most hotels. I found the location very good, 7/11 over the road, plenty of shops etc, in the middle of the CBD. Breakfast was ordinary, though it was ok for the money. The rooms also, large and comfortable, though a little tired, but again. You get what you pay for, and i think for Singapore the Strand is good value for money. Would I stay again? Absolutely

Reviews.Title: “Clean basic hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: travellerly
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 7, our 3rd time in Singapore as a family but first time in Strand Hotel. The hotel satisfied all the requirements we were looking for : cleanliness, spacious rooms, peace and quiet, near MRT stations, near food outlets, and for a reasonable price since we wanted to get two rooms for 4 nights. I had a difficult time looking for a hotel online that allowed triple/quad sharing. In Strand, we were allowed to book a triple (3 single beds) for our teens and a quad (2 queen sized beds) for us with the two kids. The rooms and the bathrooms (both with a bathtub) were very clean, with new sheets and fresh towels everyday. However, the hotel toiletries provide merely liquid hand/body soap and house shampoo so you might want to bring your own. Hotel is at the end of Orchard Road, across Kopitiam (24 hour food bars) and 7-11, near two MRT stations (Bras Basah and Dhoby Ghaut) and the bus stop at Rendezvous Hotel beside our hotel. We were also able to hear Sunday Mass at Cathedral of the Good Shepherd (walking distance) . Breakfast was basic but satisfactory for us who were always on the go --- consisted of plated bacon, hotdogs, eggs, pork and beans and hash browns coupled with buffet cereals, pancakes, french toast, bread, fruits, milk. coffee and tea. We were quite satisfied with our stay in this hotel. Thank you to the staff of Strand and to all who submitted previous reviews on Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “good place(near dhouby ghaut station int.), big family room, wifi, cheap hotel,good breakfast,”
Reviews.Author: RUBY_OF_DAVAOCITY
Reviews.Content: we've stayed there for 6 nights and the room is big for 5 of us( couple w/ 16 year old kid + twins ages 14)...location is near bras basah station. just in front is a convenient store 7-11 and restaurant called Kopitiam...breakfast is also good free flowing juice, coffee, milk, toasted bread, french toast or pancake, pasta (bihon) and a plate in of bacon,fried egg, hash brown, and sausage or bacon , scrambled egg, baked beans and sausage.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: AjayGNair
Reviews.Content: A good budget hotel located conveniently in the Bencoolen street ( one end of orchard road ) of Singapore. 2 Minutes walk to Bras Basah MRT on the circle line. Taxi and Bus stand next door. Kopitiam ( Food court ) and 7/11 store bang opposite. More or less the same breakfast everyday, but for that price cant expect more than that. Rooms are quiet spacious and clean, but the lighting is a bit poor. Good place for family. Staff are ok.

Reviews.Title: “Family Hotel and Good location”
Reviews.Author: NinHera
Reviews.Content: Hotel's service is really good, friendly and accommodating staff. Family room is big enough for 7 people. Location is near Bugis Center and Orchard road... nearest mrt station is douby ghaut. Price is reasonable. Easy to find food because of KOP|TIAM and 7-11 across the street. I will surely stay here again in my next SG visit.

Reviews.Title: “If you can stay across the street at the Bay View do it!”
Reviews.Author: Bell84
Reviews.Content: Decent enough for the money. The wifi never did work- I used the Bay View's signal. And the breakfast is simply terrible- don't even bother. The rooms are clean and spacious, however and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Only for one night - no more!”
Reviews.Author: globality
Reviews.Content: We booked one night at The Strand because we were desperate for a room to stay for our last night in Singapore. We went to the reception area to request to look for a room before booking & the porter showed us to a nice airy room. When we got back the next day to check in, they put us in a dark, squalid, small room. Much smaller than what we inspected and agreed on the day before (although price was the same - we were too tired to complain and move). The carpets were dark and looked dirty - I don't even want to walk barefoot on it. And I've never stayed in a hotel without a hair dryer before or bars of soap! The reception kept asking if we wanted a wake-up call but when we got to our room to request one, the phone wasn't working! First there was no dial tone then when there was a dial tone it couldn't even contact reception. Epic fail. Some of the staff are quite helpful but I still won't stay in this hotel again or recommend it. For another 50 SGD, just stay at the Ibis in Bencoolen.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Find in Expensive Singapore”
Reviews.Author: citrusmix74
Reviews.Content: Booked a room that was good for 4 people. Behold that when we checked-in the room ,the room could still fit 2 more people. The room was nothing fancy, a bit dark too--maybe because of the room color/paint--it was purple and green/blue--not really the usual hotel colors but the room was clean and for the price, it was a find compared to other hotels in Singapore. Don't expect much from the breakfast that comes with the room rate, it's just cereals, bread and milk. If you're a heavy breakfast eater, just head across to the Kopitiam or 7-Eleven. The Kopitiam is open 24-7 and offers an assortment of dishes from Chinese, Malay, Japanese, Italian, etc. Come night-time, it becomes like a bar, where beer is served and tables are set up on the street corner. Wide-screen TVs are even set up for some sports viewing. Location-wise, it's very close to a train station and walking distance to Orchard road, and Chijmes. If you're in for a long walk, Clarke Quay is not too far away too though taxis can be easily hailed anytime of the day. Before i forget, high speed internet works and it comes free with the room rate!

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it”
Reviews.Author: Ricci_Delrosario
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 times with wife. Room is big enough considering this is a budget hotel. Location is superb. Near Dhoby Gaut MRT terminal, walking distance to Orchard road, near Capita mall and Sim Lim. Kopitiam is just across the street. I think it's open 24 hrs. Ordered food there at such a late time. 7-11 is just across too. Service staff are good. Cleanliness is maintained. Breakfast needs to be improved. Wi Fi connectivity is good. Well worth for your money.

Reviews.Title: “not a racist hotel”
Reviews.Author: jasmine3689
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed in this hotel last Dec.24, 2009. Ive stayed in this hotel with my family. this hotel is clean, affordable, spacious, and near orchard. very comfortable and i love the queen size bed. we've only stayed here for one night and we transfer to anther hotel near my sisters apartment. I didn't experience any discrimination in this hotel. the staff is okay. we have a sumptuous buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious rooms, Excellent value for money, absolutely no problems!”
Reviews.Author: D_Rajakumar
Reviews.Content: I am familiar with Strand Hotel at Bencoolen street, Singapore because I had stayed there a few times before in the past 15 years. The rooms are very spacious and clean. The bathroom is also very spacious with a bathtub and shower curtain. Coffee and Tea along with all other complimentary stuff makes it a wholesome package. The complimentary breakfast is continental, does not provide a great spread or anything, and is just okay; no complaints though. The location is central, the Koppitiam food court right across the road is a great convenience too. We loved staying here... and will go there any number of times in future as well.

Reviews.Title: “Above average budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: mitchells51
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Strand Hotel for two nights. It was clean, comfortable, very central and the A/C worked well. Persevere with the staff. They are friendly and helpful but were initially 'cautious'. Avoid the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: altered_moon
Reviews.Content: The Strand Hotel over at Bencoolen St. is a great place to stay at. It's simple but it's enough for anyone who's trying to stay on budget. It's also quite near the train station as well as other famous landmarks. There's a kopi tiam a short walk away which is open 24 hours. Housekeeping is attentive and you get free breakfast for each day of your stay. If I were to visit Singapore again, I wouldn't mind booking the Strand Hotel for my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, good value hotel......”
Reviews.Author: Hanabelle
Reviews.Content: We were given a family room good for 5 adults ...The room was fairly clean and spacious, toilet/bathroom is clean and with separate doors, my only complain is that it is not well lighted and has one socket..with small ref , lcd tv, kettle ....with simple breakfast of toast, cereals , coffee and juice....but for 230SGD for 5 person a night, this is quite ok, considering that it already very expensive in Singapore..

Reviews.Title: “good place if you just want somewhere central to sleep”
Reviews.Author: ctcCarshalton
Reviews.Content: Nice staff ,rooms dark and basic but free wifi avail. Very central but only stay here if you just want somewhere to sleep, the breakfast was awful so dont bank on this to keep you going till lunch

Reviews.Title: “Value for $$ hotel”
Reviews.Author: enay
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel thrice and never disappoint me. It is a budget hotel but considering the room size, and everything in the room, you would never thought so. There are a few other budget hotels around that area like hotel 81 but the Strand is way better in terms of room size, cleanliness and price! I paid SGD 75, thru the hotel website and indeed it's value for $$! I love the way they paint the walls purple, kind of kinky and romantic. The room is well furnished with a single sofa, table lamps, LCD tv, comfortable queen size bed. What's more can you ask, it's simply affordable and cheap! The frontdesk people may not be as friendly as they should be but the stay worth my money. I wldnt care about others for the $$ I'm paying, I got a comfortable stay in the Strand! Would definitely come again!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: C400D
Reviews.Content: I checked in on the 29/03 - 31/03 with my family (4 adults, and my daughter (1 year 10 months)). After reading reviews from Tripadvisor, we decided to give it a try staying at this hotel. We booked a room to accomodate 4 persons. When we arrived, the check-in process went smoothly, and the counter staff was quite helpful. The room was spacious enough to easily accomodate 4 adults. The bathroom was clean and basic. I was told by the hotel staff that the bathroom was recently renovated. Free breakfast was provided. There were only corn flakes and toast served beside tea and coffee... What else can you expect from a budget hotel.... The hotel staff was very helpful in helping us arranging our trip. We feel that the hotel is worth the money...

Reviews.Title: “Old, smelly, pricey ! DONT STAY THERE !!”
Reviews.Author: tokay96
Reviews.Content: Booked via email to hotel's website. Already mentioned that we're 5 persons. But as we arrived they gave us a family room with only 4 beds !!! Stupid ! Room smells bad just like they never cleaned the carpet. DOnt have hairdryer. Hotwater shower only worked after you call front office complaining (so you have to call them everytime you go for a shower). TV picture was really poor. Breakfast is terrible...only toast,marmalade and cereal....every day. Cafe staffs were very rude. They have 2 kinds of breakfast coupons, but never explained why we got the lower-kasta menu instead of bacon, egg, sausage we saw some western and chinese people had. Dont stay there !! There're other hotels on Bencoolen street which are much more better, eg Bencoolen hotel, Bayview, and IBIS. We saw the room at Bayview as we considered to move to other hotel.....it's just verrrry comfy....180 degree contrary from Strand.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Saranghae
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in family room for 5 person and the room is big enough for us...clean and simple...the bathroom is good and clean with adequate water supply for showering. The best thing of this hotel is the location which is very strategic with the Kopitiam and 711 just a cross the street.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: East_London_Chap
Reviews.Content: This is a reasonably centrally located hotel with 5-7 mintues walk from the MRT station (the metro system in Singapore). The hotel is clean and basic. The rooms are of tolerable size, not large but not too small either. The staff are reasonably helpful. The place does the job if you are only looking for a place to sleep whilst you wonder round Singapore. In addition, it is reasonably priced for Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “decent budget hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: syasir
Reviews.Content: I wanted a budget hotel with a central Singapore location, like near Little India with Muslim halal food available, near an MRT station, and/or near Orchard Road. I had my wife and 2 small kids, otherwise I would've been satisfied with a hostel. We were there 4 nights and was totally satisfied with the Strand. It's also near an interchange MRT, Dhoby Ghaut, where 2 MRT lines cross, so you can go in 4 directions, towards Orchard Rd (shopping), the Zoo/ Night Safari, and towards Sentosa island, our prime destinations (you need to change to a bus after the MRT to get to the Zoo or Sentosa). Little India is a ten minute walk away. Marina bay, the Flyer (ferris wheel), etc. are not far away. Halal Indian roadside cafe is a block away (<5 mins walk). 24 hr seven eleven store was across the street. The Bencoolen Mosque, a travel agency, money changer, and many hotels were all next door, on Bencoolen street. I did quite enough of research on the internet, looked up the hotels within my budget that were being offered in the Singapore Airlines deal and near Orchard Rd, particularly nearby hotels Bencoolen, Ibis, and two in Little India. The cheapest of these, yet decent & comfy, was the Strand. At SG$ 100 (approx. US$ 70) with breakfast for two (my children ate free too), it was a good deal. I also checked out the Fortuna hotel opposite 24-hr Mustafa shopping center (Little India), but it did not have a cafe/restaurant, and the next door MRT station (Faber Park) is not as main a station as Dhoby Ghaut. (note: with kids and a pram, its not easy using the MRT and changing trains.) Getting a taxi or public bus, or bus service to the zoo, were also easy. If you don't like this hotel, you can check out any of the numerous hotels next door on Bencoolen street and be sure to like one in your budget range, e.g. hotel 81, Ibis (an international chain), Bencoolen, Rendezvous, etc. The YMCA is also nearby. I booked it over the counter, room availability was not a problem in early August. When we checked in, the only thing not working was the fridge, which was changed on our request. Facilities included a 25-30" LCD TV (no cartoon channels for the kids though), a fridge, an electronic safe, a smallish cupboard for hanging clothes, telephone, central air-conditioning that worked, internet connection, and a good, clean bathroom with hot water. Iron with stand is provided free on request. The staff was friendly, but the reception staff need more etiquette, though they were helpful. Two computers with paid internet are in the lobby, as are free brochures of Singapore, a standard feature I think supported by the Singapore visitors center. All in all, a satisfying & comfortable stay. I would recommend it to anyone who is money/expense conscious, also fellow Muslims & people from the Indian subcontinent, as the mosque is nearly next door. Families staying there were of all nationalities, I saw a few westerners too.

Reviews.Title: “Try to avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Explorerbkk
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is the worst i had ever stayed in I work in the Hotel business myself and i never experienced such unfriendly staff. Upon check in i mentioned that the room rate was higher what i was told the day before on the telephone. The answer was just : Take it or leave it !!! And there is no Breakfast and he told me i had to check out at 10am ( normal is 12 ) The room standart was below average, broken Fridge and very dirty overall. I have to mention that there was a very intensive smell of clorine. I called the Front desk and ask if they have another room because of the very bad smell, but was told that i can move out if i would like to. This behaivor is not accepteble and i will never, ever visit this hotel again For a room rate as high as this ( SG 160 ) you can even expect in Singapore at least a better service. Many Guesthouses having a higher standart then this hotel I am not a difficult hotel guest . But i travel alot and this was my worst experience i had in my entire life.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location+Huge Room=Happy Holiday in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Sue_Tiramisu
Reviews.Content: Before travelling to Singapore, I did a lot of research on the areas of Singapore and the hotels. I emailed each hotel I was keen on to see whether they could offer a better rate than the numerous websites.... The Strand Hotel is located near Orchard Road, - I had decided earlier on that the hotel would have to be within walking distance to an MRT Station. On the map, it looked near enough, but in reality, it takes about 2-3 minutes walking which can be painful if you have been walking all day! The rate they offered me was among the cheapest I got and after reading the reviews here, I decided to stay here....and I am glad I did!!!! The hotel looks a bit dated - lobby isn't fancy and the cafe is small and simple but we were happy. We never wanted to pay to stay in a fancy hotel where we wouldn't be using the facilities anyway. Firstly the room is HUGE......3-4 people would be lying on the floor in sleeping bags and it would still be comfy. There is a huge LCD TV but not too impressed with the reception. We got clear reception of AXN though. There is a kettle and 4 satchets of instant milk tea and coffee. No complimentary mineral water. I would have preferred mineral water. Soap is via a dispenser - one near the sink, the other at the showering area. Towels are provided, as were a pair of toothbrushes complete with toothpaste. I brought my own shampoo and soap so it wasn't much of a problem. The bathroom is clean but I think they should work towards removing the tub and replacing it with a shower cubicle which should be more practical. Service was efficient - check in was painless. One night our air cond went kaput and I called down. Within 5 mins someone came to look at it. When he had determined that there was indeed something wrong, someone came to look at it. The next morning, the air cond went wonky again and we told the reception before we left. When we came back, there were people fixing it. Next thing we knew the air cond was fixed. Yippee. Breakfast is simple. Cornflakes and milk and toast. Coffee and tea. That's it. On the second day I ordered eggs. $3 for 2 eggs done any which way you want. Across the road from the hotel is KOPITIAM, an air conditioned foodcourt which was persistantly full. Next to it is a 7-11, very handy for midnight cravings. Transport from this area is ABUNDANT! There is a bus stop right in front of Rendezvous Hotel next door - you can get practically anywhere getting a bus here. I took buses here to the Esplanade and Bugis and the airport. Buses to Little India can be gotten on Prinsep St just on the road behind the hotel. Of course, it helps that Singapore has such an efficient transport system. The Singapore Art Museum is about a minute walk away. Chijmes and Raffles is also within walking distance. When we stayed there, they were having a Night Festival in Stamford which we didn't go to due to having very very tired feet......what a shame. Anyway, I couldn't recommend this hotel enough. Fantastic location, comfy and clean rooms - what else can a traveller ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: albavsie
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Singapore June 4, 2009 early morning 2:00, We did not have a problem checking in at this hotel, Room are okay , we stay at room 1107, spacious room, and all the staff are polite and accomodating. Shopping is not a problem since its near to Orchard road, little india, singapore flyer, sentosa, marina bay, bugis. Staying in that hotel is recommendable. See you next time.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Milly1917
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable bed; staff friendly and helpful; room has large TV, mini fridge, closet, drawers, two bedside lamps; location convenient; included breakfast ample. A real bargain for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: qb20
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute choice because other plans fell through. I paid 80 SGD per night for a double room and I felt like I could've found better value if I had researched hotels a bit better (and spent a little more time on TripAdvisor beforehand!). Before deciding to stay here I asked to see my room: the first room they showed me was a smoker's room but relatively clean; the 2nd room smelled like mildew and the bathroom wall connecting with the main part of the room was all glass (so anyone in the room could completely see into the bathroom - bizarre); and the 3rd room (along with the entire 8th floor) smelled like mothballs. So I went with the 1st room, the least of all evils. I would not feel comfortable recommending this hotel given the wide variety of rooms, just from my small sample. But, the location is great, on the end of Orchard Road, the hotel is easily accessible by bus, the price included breakfast (didn't try it so can't comment) and the rooms themselves were on the larger side.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfying stay with great location!”
Reviews.Author: Ziera
Reviews.Content: Ziera, Kuala Lumpur Stayed there from 24-26 December 2008. Me, hubby and my 2-year old daughter went to stay there for two nites. I would say this is a great budget hotel. The first time we stepped our foot at the hotel entrance, we were greeted by some friendly staff. The lobby wasn't that big but they did have a well-decorated christmas tree though. My daughter had great fun posing infront of the christmas tree for this is her first time seeing christmas. The room is very spacious but the bed is quite small for 3 persons. If you have a bigger kids, then you might need a bigger bed. They have a plasma TV with remote control, unlike the reviews i read when they stayed there in 2006. Honestly, i have no major problem staying in this hotel. Two problems. One, there is no water tap near the toilet bowl. As a muslim, we wash immediately after we do our thing, not just wipe it with toilet tissues. So, this is a bit problem. Had to find a container or something to get the water from the bath tub. Second problem, the hotel did not provide a guide/sighn for muslim prayer. I really think this is saddening coz Singapore also has Muslim communities and the tourists do come from various Muslim countries. In Kuala Lumpur, all of our hotels be it a two stars or the 6 stars hotel, have never fail to provide the guide/sigh for Muslims. Overall, goodnot a bad hotel. Can be improved.

Reviews.Title: “Love the location”
Reviews.Author: cheekyjiva
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 days. Had the family room with 6 beds. The room is huge and very clean. The toilet is separated from the shower but the wall between them does not go up the whole height of the room so you can chat with your friends while doing your business hahah They have plasma TV in the room. And a small fridge. Tea/coffee making facilities need to be improved. The breakfast served is not Halal so we only had breakfast (egg) there on the first day. One the second and third day we ate outside. Much cheaper of course and excellent for our malay palate (teh tarik and roti canai) The lady at the reception was very rude. I can communicate in English but she always asked me to clarify my requests by saying "HUH?", with that demeaning look on her face. Please lady, be polite. I didn't like the way I was treated so I always asked for the guy next to her. He's nice and helpful. He wears glasses and seems young. One time, I was talking to him and she suddenly butt in our conversation. I ignored her. Anyway, the hotel is within walking distance to Dhoby Gaut MRT (did I spell it right?), Bugis Junction and the shopping malls, and most importantly Waterloo where you can get car spare parts at a much cheaper price. There are also a small production house and a dance community house in Waterloo Street. This area is very cultural. The aunties who clean our room are very friendly. We feel sorry for them because they're old. So tip them extra OK?

Reviews.Title: “Sky high roomprices now”
Reviews.Author: woodenshoe_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed again in Strand in February 2007 and had booked a room via internet. The roomrate was SGD 100, so in one year a raise of SGD 20. No breakfast included. That was no problem because Kopitiam (a big food court) was on the other side of the street. For that roomrate the hotel is not bad at all, however now (at the end of 2008) we are going again to Singapore and asked the manager (Mr Ivy) via internet the roomrate at the moment. The price now was SGD 180 (unbelievable), breakfast included. I asked whether the rooms were renovated. The answer was: in Singapore all hotelprices were raised up to 80 to 100%, so also Strand. Well for that price there are much better hotels in Singapore, so make your choice. J. Huiskes the Netherlands

Reviews.Title: “Stranded at the Singpore Strand,”
Reviews.Author: Fredecules
Reviews.Content: I have been a long time resident of Singapore and stayed at the Strand on a few occasions when returnig to the island state. Once I walked in at three am after a long flight and was given a room with a minimum of fuss. After that I became a fan. I love the fact that one or two floors are given over to Thai Katoey ( (ladyboys/transvestities) which adds to the colour. You never know who or what you may meet in the lift and one night I met a wanker banker type in a close clinch with one of the said transverstites. I wondered if he knew what he was dealing with!!! I suppose those who suggest it as a family hotel are broadminded enough to think that their children need a certain amount of exposure to the real world ( or is it the unreal world?) The fabulously surley staff are a hangover from old Singapore rather than the new squeaky clean corporate Singapore we are forced to deal with now. They have attitude and ain't afraid to show it! Rooms are decorated by friends of the owner and a colourful lot of friends she must have. But they are large and quiet, and the cleaning staff are all friendly. As for the food? only one word of advice - DON"T! just head across the road to the food court or explore further afield to get great singapore food. No need to put up with the offal they serve at the Strand! And yes they probably do hire out rooms on a short term basis but then it is a hotel after all! All in all I would and have recommended it to other. Mostly they hated it.

Reviews.Title: “a satisfying stay”
Reviews.Author: 50boy
Reviews.Content: upon our arrival we stayed first at the YMCA. its double room was very small even its beds were very narrow. we had no choice but take 2 double rooms for a small family of 4. next day, we sought out strand hotel's family room. at about 50sqm it had a wide queen bed, and 2 wide double beds plus a space just as big as our room at the YMCA. The bonus -- it was 60% cheaper! we had a very wide flat tv, ever ready cleaning ladies. of course, there are some letdowns-- breakfast is bad, the color is gloomy. nevertheless, i would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Creepy!”
Reviews.Author: Balgowlah
Reviews.Content: I can see why this was one of the very few hotels available in Singpore when everything was booked out. We had no choice but to stay here after arriving from Frankfurt without a Singpore hotel booking. The room was very large and the beds comfortable enough. Thankfully the bathroom was clean but very basic. What was creepy was that the entire room, including the ceiling was painted a strong lime green. Add to this a large, sinister light fitting in the corner and you're in for a bad night's sleep! The TV was so old, there was no remote control and the towels were threadbare and a bit smelly. A very basic breakfast included "make your own" instant coffee which we did not hang around for. For SIN$250 we learnt our lesson in making a hotel booking before arriving in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Run, don’t walk, away from this calamity!”
Reviews.Author: LvtrvlLA
Reviews.Content: Run, don’t walk, away from this calamity – not worth the hassle and not much of a budget hotel at a rate of just under USD 150 per night! I have never witnessed such rude, incompetent desk staff, or been treated as poorly by them, as I was at the Strand. My husband made a reservation for a double room, via e-mail, directly with the hotel manager. She confirmed our flight number & details including our 8pm late flight arrival. When we arrived at the hotel around 9pm, a female receptionist verbally assaulted us with a lack of logic and extreme rudeness first insisting that we were someone else – she wouldn’t bother to look at my husband’s passport to see the correct spelling of our name. She said our room was no longer available as we were late. When we insisted that we confirmed a late arrival with her Manager she argued with us and when we insisted on seeing the e-mail attached to the reservation she had in her hand we finally proved that it wasn’t even our reservation she was holding. She then produced our actual reservation and curtly advised us that our room wasn’t ready yet as it was still occupied & we’d have to wait for our room to be cleaned once the occupants checked out. When we pointed out that it was 9PM – way past the hour of any standard late check out offered by a normal hotel, not to mention the fact that they were double renting the room, she acted as if it was a perfectly normal procedure and that we should be happy with waiting for them to clean the room (despite having traveled all day and being tired). Exhausting our patience Ms. take-it-or-leave-it told us we would now need to take a small room with two single beds if we wanted to stay here. We advised her we were paying for a double, which had been confirmed, and pre-paid for. After a heated argument with me accusing them of renting the room by the hour for prostitution, purposes, which she never denied, my husband learned from a male front desk clerk assisting a client in the same situation, that there were two rooms available in the hotel; the single and a “special” double. My husband asked to speak to the manager who, off duty, was contacted by phone. The Manager spoke to the lady assisting us who lied directly in front of us insisting that the “occupied room” and single room were the only rooms available and there was no other double room. We then told the manager about the “special” double room available and had to hand the phone to the male desk clerk who confirmed that yes, the double room did exist. The Manager then offered her apologies and after first asking us to pay more ($10) for the room, finally agreed to let us have the room due to our astonishment at their dark-age business practices. The “special” room we were given after defeating the Barbarians is best described as pimp meets vampire; dark grey walls, curtains and carpeting with some bizarre purple, snakeskin covered headboard/ceiling contraption that served no purpose including that of attempting to be a hip decoration. Incase the purple snakeskin wasn’t enough, the green flower tower lamps next to it added that extra oomph of tackiness. The paint was chipped and missing in several places and the wood counters were also chipped and stained (Vampire rituals perhaps?) I’d hate to see the standard rooms if that was a special room. The room had a TV, without a remote, a mini fridge, safe, hotpot and small shower, which along with the toilet and sink, was encased in a glass cube. Amenities were scant; a broken liquid soap dispenser in the shower and another on the counter and two bath towels (but no hand or face towels). The room was fairly quiet and our stay was uneventful however our check-in experience cast a bad light on our stay and left us grumpy and weary. There has to be a better choice for a budget hotel in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, big, quiet rooms.”
Reviews.Author: mahonah
Reviews.Content: I used to live in Singapore. In the 5 years since I moved back to NYC, I have passed through several times and always stay at the Strand (8 or so stays so far). The most compelling reasons are PRICE and LOCATION. Beyond that I feel comfortable in the rooms, I always get good rest, it appears to be safe and secure (I've kept professional video production equipment in my room), the aircon always works well. The rooms are large for Singapore budget hotel standards. Rooms in the same price range at three other hotels that I've checked out are all about half the size. My local friends do sometimes get surprised that I am a loyal customer. Suffice it to say that until recently there was an "hourly rate" card sitting on the reception desk. But in my experience the hotel has only ever been a quiet, calm, good place to get over jet-lag. Yes, I have had challenges with customer service at reception. I am certain, however, that it is commensurate with what is available for that price in Singapore. Housekeeping and bell staff have always been pleasant and very helpful. As others have noted, there are no toiletries provided apart from a liquid soap dispenser in the shower. Oddly, they do not provide you with a bathmat, so ask housekeeping for an extra towel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: VikasRana
Reviews.Content: Was visiting Singapore for the first time, and unfortunately had to stay at this hotel. The treatment that the guys at reception give to the visitors is not very warm. When I landed at the reception, was inquired with questions like "do you have money to deposit?", I felt like replying "no I do not and just wondering if you could let me stay here for free". Anyway that was first part of the story, I had to stay in singapore a bit long which I told the hotel on very first interaction at the reception. Then on couple of days before my departutre, I got a note saying make a payment by eod today. Now if they are so suspicious of the guests, they should tell them in advance that this is how the payment schedules going to be. To make the situation worse, I was not aware of the fact that banks close in Singapore by 3 pm, so could not convert my currency in S$. The same evening hell broke loose, the same lady who greeted me on first day was questioning me..."now how are you going to make payment?", "it was told to you to make payment in the morning...you have to make the payment today...close your account..." Man I felt like I should just go ahead and look for a nearby hotel, but unfortunately because of IMF event, all hotels were prebooked and were not realy in a mood to shift just for one night. This is one experience and I do agree fully with another review on this page, which highlights not only the dull interiors but the important outside area of the hotel, which at night looks like some downtown rowdy place. Strictly avoid, you can get much better hotels in Singapore for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “good location, disappointing room”
Reviews.Author: gway25
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in early August. Arriving late in the evening after having spent the day travelling from Siem Reap via Bangkok, we were looking forward to grabbing something to eat and getting some sleep. Reception, lifts and corridors gave a good impression but this evaporated when we saw the room - very basic and gloomy but we were too tired to bother trying to change. Bedding was clean but old, window had no inner curtains, powerpoints were grubby, TV had no remote, room needed more lighting, cracked toilet seat in the bathroom and just a liquid soap dispenser over the bath - and the vacuum cleaner clearly hadn't made it as far as the edges of the carpet for some time. However, the bathroom was clean, there was plenty of hot water and the staff were helpful. It's OK as a budget stay and the position is great but the website does lead one to expect a bit more than it delivers.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: ish-uk
Reviews.Content: stayed for 5 nights the room was ok everything looked a bit old but was a least kept clean. like a previous reviewer said the sheets were old and a few times had cig holes in them. thought the location was good near a mrt station (5 mins walk)had a seven eleven opposite and a small hawker centre. staff were nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Quality Indeed!!”
Reviews.Author: AshJones
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Strand Hotel for 4 nights in February 2006. There can be no doubt that this hotel is very well situated for walking to the hustle bustle of Orchard Road and also to Little India and the Raffles complex. However, as a regular world - budget traveller I was deeply disappointed by the general standard of this establishment. My room was described as a 'Special room'. Just what was 'Special' I never grasped. Perhaps it was the fact that the shower/toilet room had a glass door (this in practice meant that both myself and my girlfriend took to using the toilet facilities at the nearby high class hotels to avoid the dignity removing process of visiting the lavatory in full view of one's partner). Perhaps 'Special' referred to the cigarette burns in the blanket or the radio beside my bed which had exposed live wires, who knows! Also disconcerting was the fact that the front of the hotel is a gathering point for local prostitutes. Every evening we returned to the hotel from an night out there were at least 2 girls working the street directly outside the main doors of the hotel (believe me, I was not mistaken, I'm a cop by profession and I know what I saw). Also alarming was the fact that the hotel has a pool table in the verranda area at the front of the premises, this in turn always attracted a large group of swarthy individuals who loittered at the front of the hotel until midnight on every night of my stay. On the whole I would describe my stay as unsatisfactory, even my initial e-mail to book the room took 3 further e-mails to confirm that the Strand had recieved my request. The Strand was dated in decoration and not to the high cleanliness standards that I saw in evidence at other Singapore hotels. I felt generally unsafe in the area immediately outside the hotel and the room fell below acceptable standards in decor and furnishings. I would suggest potential visitors look beyond the budget price and consider paying a small amount more for a higher standard hotel. I would not recommend this hotel to any visitor to Singapore and would certainly not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Strand Hotel: Great value”
Reviews.Author: Erniecat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Strand Hotel for one week. It was my first visit to Singapore. As many of you know, the Strand is a budget hotel in a very good location, on Bencoolen Street, near the intersection of Bras Basah Road. I thought the location was ideal because it allowed us to walk to either Orchard Road or to the city center, near City Hall MRT and the River/Esplanade area. Also, I was within walking distance of several MRT stations, with Dhoby Ghaut being the closest, at 5 minutes away. Dhoby Ghaut is a great station because two MRT lines stop there, including the one that takes you to the Night Safari and Zoo. Other MRT stops fairly close by were City Hall and Bugis. As for the hotel itself, I must say that I was extremely happy there and thought it was pretty incredible value for the money. I paid S$85 per night, which included service and taxes. My room, which had one large bed, was very large. I liked it because half the room was sort of like a living area, with a table and nice big chair, and plenty of empty space. And there was plenty of space to store our clothes and other stuff. There were two drawers in the living area, attached to the desk, and there was a decent-sized closet near the entrance. What I really liked was the bench that was attached to the back wall that extended along the periphery of the living area. It was a great spot to keep things like brochures and other papers, or anything that normally would just clog up the dresser, bed or table. The room was clean and decorated nicely. The bathroom was modern, clean and functional, though not particularly large. As usual in Asia, the shower head was designed for someone considerably less than 6 feet tall. My only real complaint was that the room did not have adequate lighting once the sun went down. There were small fixtures scattered about, but an overhead light would have been nice. But this was not a very big deal. The service was really good. Whenever I needed anything (usually an extra towel), I would call and someone would come to my room within 1-5 minutes. Once, someone was there in around 20 seconds. Even though the Strand is billed as a "budget" hotel, it does not feel like a budget hotel at all. The lobby is fairly big and the reception desk is long and well serviced. There is a bellhop/doorman to help get you a taxi. The hallways are very nice and wide. The lifts both work great. Everything is very, very clean and well-maintained. Very professional staff. Things like this really make you feel like you are staying in a very decent place. The bottom line: If you are not seeking luxury, and are looking for an inexpensive yet very functional hotel and do not care about facilities (no pool, no gym), then you probably can do no better than the Strand while in Singapore. I've stayed in many hotels in many places, and cannot recall a hotel that offered better value.

Reviews.Title: “Economical, Clean, Quiet, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Rob1
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located on Bencoolen Street near Bras Basah Road, the Strand represents good value at an economy price. Across the street from the slightly pricier City Bayview and beside the first class Rendezvous, this high-rise hotel boasts an excellent central location, within walking distance of many Singapore attractions, the MRT, and "hop-on/hop-off" tourist buses. The lobby is clean and well lit, a few steps above street level, with a wall of glass between the lobby and the street, and a sheltered entrance. The staff is very accomodating but not as knowledgeable as a concierge in a five star hotel. The rooms are large and spacious, the beds firm and comforable, including the "roll-away" beds, and each room comes well equipped with chair, desk, mirror, side chairs and table, good cable television, mini-fridge, room safe, and lots of closet and storage space. The bathrooms are well finished but spartan, with none of the usual amenities like bar soap, toothbrushes, or shampoo. There is one liquid soap/shampoo dispenser inconveniently located on the shower wall (bring your own bar of soap). The single sink is set in a large counter space, with bathtub and shower on the opposite wall. Entry to the room is by magnetic swipe card, which also controls the lighting. The rooms are well lit and the air conditioning is good and fully adjustable. Electrical outlets will require an adaptor to accomodate North American plugs. Local telephones calls may be made from the room at a reasonable rate (S$0.10) and you may direct direct for international calls (IDD). The windows are large and may be opened if (hot and humid Singapore) fresh air is desired. Halls and elevators are clean and modern. There is a small on-site dining cafe on the main floor beside the lobby with limited hours for meals; it is not open during off meal hours though room service is available for extended hours. But, across the street is a Seven-Eleven and beside that, on the corner of Bras Basah Road and Bencoolen Street, is a Kopitian where you can obtain all of your meals cafeteria-style with prices to match; the Kopitian is a series of vendor stalls in an air conditioned, clean and modern food court, which also boasts a shaded outdoor patio where you may sample western, malaysian, chinese, and indian cuisine and while you eat enjoy the street activity through the full height windows lining the two sides facing the street. There are ice cream vendors and fresh fruit vendors as well. If your tastes are more upscale, the Rendez-vous next door to the Strand Hotel provides a first class buffet at a mid-market price. The Strand is an inexpensive S$16-20 fare to/from the airport (though rates increase after midnight), or S$7 shuttle bus fare per person. The nearest MTR station, Dhoby/Ghaut on the North South line (station NS24), is a short relaxing 5-10 minute walk. Dhoby/Ghant is your transit connection to the Night Safari. The SIA (Singapore International Airlines) Hop-On tourist bus stops opposite the Rendezvous hotel where Selegie Road meets Orchard Road, so you are within 100 metres of very convenient tourist transportation; the SIA Hop-On operates from 9am to 6 pm every half hour and costs S$3 per SIA passenger (SSH stop-over passengers no charge) or S$8 adult/S$5 child per day for all others (unlimited all day pass). The Hop-On bus is operated for SIA by S H Tours/asiatours (routing info. available on the web). Alternatively, the SBS Transit (Singapore Bus Service) operates double decker City Buzz buses (S$1 per trip or S$5 all day pass) with stops at Dhoby Ghaut or the Singapore Art Museum, both close to the hotel. Operating hours are 10:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. with scheduled frequency every 10-15 minutes. The CityBuzz routing info. is available on the SBSTransit website (together with all other SBSTransit route info.) Both buses provide excellent and inexpensive means for seeing the tourist sights of Singapore (though only SIA Hop-on will go as far afield as the Botanical Gardens.) A 20-30 minute walk up Waterloo Street (running parellel to Bencoolen) will take you along a pedestrian friendly historic street which eventually becomes a pedestrian mall where you may experience several temples, a modern department store, and Indian shopping. A much longer trek (45 minutes to an hour) will take you all the way to little India. Walking 30 minutes down Bras Basah Road will take you by the Singapore Art Museum (admission and group guide S$3 adults/$1.50 child/senior -free on Fridays, I think), with opportunities for a convenient walk through Chijmes and the grounds of the Raffles Hotel, superior shopping at Raffles City, and the large (but largely unimpressive) shopping at Suntec City. Walking from your hotel in the other direction will take you to the start of Orchard Road shopping (but it's a long road virtually impossible to cover on foot). All in all, I found the Strand to be ideally located for exploring Singapore.

HotelInfo.Address: 25 Bencoolen Street, Singapore 189619, Singapore
